text: Daphnella pagera is an extinct species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusc in the family Raphitomidae.Fossilworks: Daphnella pagera ==Description== The length of the shell attains 12.3 mm, its diameter 4.7 mm. ==Distribution== Fossils of this marine species were found in Miocene strata in Panama; age range: 11.608 to 7.246 Ma. ==References== * W. P. Woodring. 1970. Geology and paleontology of canal zone and adjoining parts of Panama: Description of Tertiary mollusks (gastropods: Eulimidae, Marginellidae to Helminthoglyptidae). United States Geological Survey Professional Paper 306(D):299–452 pagera Category:Gastropods described in 1970
title: Daphnella pagera
